meanings.definition: Having or showing a high social status or prestige.
meanings.sent1: The fancy car and expensive clothes made him look very statusy.
meanings.sent2: She always wore designer brands to appear statusy in front of others.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone tried to act statusy by talking about their luxury vacations.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant manners and refined taste gave her a statusy aura.
meanings.sent5: The grand mansion with its golden gates was the epitome of statusy living.

meanings.definition: A person who is perceived as having a high social status or prestige.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity was considered a statusy in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent2: She mingled effortlessly with the statusies at the exclusive event.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought he was a statusy, strutting around with a tiny bow tie.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she was a rising star among the statusies.
meanings.sent5: The royal family was the ultimate example of statusies in society.
